headline: My Special Shrimp Scampi Florentine
description: This shrimp scampi has the fresh flavors of tomatoes, spinach, and pesto. Serve over rice with hot Italian bread on the side.
name: My Special Shrimp Scampi Florentine
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons prepared basil pesto (such as Classico ™)
2 large plum tomatoes, seeded and diced
0.25 teaspoon red pepper flakes, or to taste
1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
2 cups fresh spinach, rinsed and stemmed

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the butter and the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in pesto, garlic, and tomatoes, and simmer until the tomatoes start to soften, about 2 minutes. Season with red pepper flakes and black pepper to taste.
Stir the shrimp into the sauce, and cook just until they turn pink, 3 to 5 minutes. Add the spinach, and stir until wilted, about 1 minute.

I doubled this and served it at a dinner party and it was a big hit! Colorful, easy and not so much time in the kitchen. Didn't have prepared pesto, but I did have fresh basil so I used that instead.
Made it several times exactly according to the recipe. It is delish!

This was the bomb! My husband raved about how delicious it was! The only modifications I mad was to add about a 1/2 cup of savignoin white wine and I added the red pepper flakes to each finished dis as not everyone in the house can handle that heat. I also added 5oz of fresh spinach that I roughly chopped. Served over rice. So good the two of us ate it all.

So I made the recipe (using all of the recommended ingredients except the salt) but "eye-balling" the measurements to my liking) and served it over cornmeal mush (polenta) that I seasoned with Butter and a hefty amount of shredded "Italian Blend" cheeses. YUM, YUM, YUM!

So easy and so delicious. Restaurant quality! Served over zucchini noodles.
I just made this recipe as written, except that I added more garlic than the recipe called for. Excellent flavors!
Great recipe. Easy to prep ahead and have meal ready to serve in 10 minutes.
I omitted the butter. It doesn't need that much fat.
So delicious will definitely be making again.
This recipe is simple and great tasting. I didn’t change it a bit. Nice when you don’t have much time to cook dinner! Love it! Thanks.

Great recipe. Easy and quick! I added a couple extra herbs, dill in particular and it was tasty.

I added lots of garlic and some jalapeño peppers and sweet peppers and onion. It was very good, enjoyed by everyone.
Excellent. Easy enough for a weeknight dinner. Delicious!
This was really good! I used my homemade pesto and only approximately 1 1/2-2 Tbsps each of the butter and olive oil. I will make it again. Quick, easy and delicious!
Excellent! I normally skip the pasta and simply serve over chopped spinach. A low carb alternative for those who prefer.

This is so delicious and easy. It is now in my regular rotation and a favorite for Lenten meatless Friday meals. I use less oil/butter than suggested.
Followed the recipe exactly.....couldn’t be better! Everyone loved it.
I kept the tomatoes and spinach fresh and topped them with the shrimp, salad-style. Added some whole grain penne. OMG this was delish!

more spices

Great flavors but too much oil. Next time I would reduce by at least half.

Really enjoyed this meal very fast and easy to make. I did cut olive oil and butter in half and used 2 heaping tablespoon of pesto. Served with angel hair pasta!
Not bad at all -- subbed in cherry tomatoes .. otherwise followed the recipe. Was well received over linguine .
Definitely would decrease the oil/butter the next time or follow suggestion of another reviewer and add white wine instead of some of the oil
Excellent dish! I cut the butter and oil on half and added 1/3 c. white cooking wine, a little more heathy for us. Ihave made this several times. Super easy.
This was so easy to make and it tasted absolutely delicious. Will definitely be making again.
This was so easy to make and it tasted absolutely delicious. Will definitely be making again.
Really good. Really easy. What more can you ask for?
This recipe is fantastic! I made absolutely no changes , except I added farfalle lol and my family loved it!! Will definitely make it again!

This recipe is great. I used it as a base but made changes. I did not use pesto or tomatoes. I used scallops and shrimp. I also reduced the amount of butter and olive oil as suggested by others and added white wine. The results were soooo good. I'm looking forward to having leftovers today.

very good

This was an outstanding recipe! I reduced the amount of butter and olive oil a tiny bit, and added a little dry white wine to make up for what I reduced. I also topped it with fresh shredded Parmesan before serving. We LOVED it!

I took the advice of other reviewers and only used 2 tbs. each of butter and olive oil. I did add more pesto (approx. 4 tbs.) and didn't add any additional garlic. I added mushrooms.
It turned out delicious and full flavor.
I replaced tomatoes with red peppers. I couldn't believe how good this was.

Made this tonight for dinner. Delicious. I love it that people can leave reviews on these dishes--as long as there are only a minor change or two to the original recipe and if there are several people recommending the same change, I usually follow it. I did cut back the butter and olive oil and added a bit of white wine and juice of 1/2 fresh squeezed lemon, and it was wonderful! I had olive pesto in the cabinet and used that. The tomatoe-y flavor of the pesto and the tomato really make the sauce good, as does the spinach. Excellent recipe.
Made as is. even the kids liked it.
i liked it but i added a squeeze from 1/4 lemon for some zest.

Minimal effort for fine Italian restaurant quality. I scaled this down to two servings (just for myself). This comes together VERY quickly. After reading reviews, I further cut back by half on the oil and butter (~1 tblsp each). My small shrimp were frozen-cooked, so I thawed and cooked just until heated. I also added a splash of white wine, and I found that it does need salt. I had as-is (no pasta), so that was a nice, low-carb treat! Definite keeper recipe!
I just halved the ingredients and my verdict can be summed up in one word...DELICIOUS!!!! Thanks so much!! Loved the recipe as written!

This was excellent! I used less butter and oil (about half amount) and more tomatoes.I used tons of spinach and it was awesome! will definitely make again!
